brief_description: The scheme provides a one-time grant of ₹10,00,000 to widows/dependents of martyred soldiers or paramilitary personnel.
detailed_description: The scheme &quot;Uttarakhand Shaheed Kosh Anudan Yojana&quot; was launched by the Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the widows/dependents of martyrs who lost their lives in internal disturbances or border skirmishes, including personnel from the armed forces and paramilitary forces. Under this scheme, a one-time lump sum grant of ₹10 lakh is provided, based on defined eligibility criteria related to the martyr's family status.
benefits: If the martyr is married, 60% to the widow (Veer Nari) and 40% to the parents If parents are deceased , 100% to the widow If the widow is deceased, 40% to parents, 60% equally to dependent children If both the widow and parents are deceased, 100% equally among the dependent children If the widow and children are absent, 100% to the parents If unmarried or widower, 100% to parents
Mode of Disbursement: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)
eligibility_criteria:
The applicant should be a widow or dependent (Parents/Children) of a martyr. The martyr should have been a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The martyr should have been a member of the Indian Armed Forces or Paramilitary Forces. The martyrdom should have occurred during:
a war, a border clash, or an internal security operation.

steps: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District Sainik Kalyan Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sainik Kalyan Office. Step 4: The application is verified at the district level by the Sainik Kalyan authorities. Step 5: Once verified and approved, the sanctioned amount is disbursed via DBT.

documents_required:
Bank account passbook of the applicant Preliminary report related to the war or incident Part-II Order issued by the Record Office/Director General's Office regarding the war incident Battle Casualty Certificate of the martyr soldier Dependent Certificate issued by the Record Office/Director General's Office confirming relationship with the martyr Discharge Book of the martyr (if applicable) Identity card of the dependent applying for the grant Non-payment Certificate issued by the District Sainik Welfare and Rehabilitation Office, confirming that no ex-gratia has been paid earlier Battle/Operational Casualty Certificate from:
Director General of Paramilitary Forces (for paramilitary cases) Director General of Central Armed Police Forces (for CAPF)
